title: Assumptions of A Normal Distribution
text: You take a simple random sample from the population. The population you are testing is normally distributed or your sample size is sufficiently large. You know the value of the population standard deviation which, in reality, is rarely known.

title: Assumptions of A Student's t-distribution
text: Your data should be a simple random sample that comes from a population that is approximately normally distributed. You use the sample standard deviation to approximate the population standard deviation.

title: Checking Assumptions
text: After reviewing the assumptions of the normal distribution and the t-distribution, we find that both can be used to test the population mean, so this criteria cannot help us distinguish between the two. However, only one of the two distributions could be used without knowing the $$\frac{true}{population}$$ standard deviation, hence this criteria should help us eliminate the distribution that is not suitable in this situation.
